column4: hi guys...downloaded 8.10 iso image, and burnt it into a cd using nero on windows XP ...but vista does not read it ? any ideas ?
the cd is a compressed boot iso
the cd is for vista on my laptop. It shows all its 700 mb is free
the image is being detected and run well by windows XP
what are you talking about?? you said you wanted to burn it, yet it's not burnt
I wanted to 1>Burn the iso image into a CD 2>Use the CD to install Ubuntu 8.10 3>The CD is not being detected by windows vista
the cd is blank thats why isn't it ?
I burnt the Image into the CD through my desktop and the image is being read from the CD on my desktop's XP
so it's probably a vista/nero issue then
ohk. sad. Any universal way sure to work ? already wasted two cds
show us the output of df -h in a pastebin please, a default ubuntu 8.10 install is about 2GB
you either have a big file on that disk, such as a video file or you've installed a lot of packages
